text: Trying out the Page Editor beta right now
I like a lot of it, but I feel like I’m going to end up clicking unpublish a million times when I am intending to save

Hey everyone, this question is coming from my marketing team. They want to be able to pull the location of several CTAs, they’re told it’s not really possible at this point. Wondering if anyone here has a work around? Maybe with the API? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Lead-Capture-Tools/Export-CTA-location-of-several-CTAs/m-p/313090>
You can hunt it down in the CTA listing view
if you're looking for a bulk of multiple cta's the easiest way is to copy and paste the content from the modals for each.
is there a form service like Jotform that lets me sync Form Values to the HS CRM? Jotform unfortunately does only offer 6 basic fields to sync in the integration
I don’t think there’s currently an easy way to do this via the API
There’s definitely an API that does this: <https://api.HubSpot.com/cosindex/api/v1/connections>
But the best I’ve been able to do is watch what’s being pulled up in the Network tab when I open a dependents/locations modal and then copy the JSON from there.
That will provide you with page IDs, then you can use this to get at the links: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#content-by-ids>
<@UBT0AHWLD> I have previously used a service called Cognito Forms linked to Zapier with then Zaps to HubSpot.  Not sure if this is what you are looking for.
<@U54TVT3C1> <https://api.HubSpot.com/cosindex/api/v1/connections> -> this link doesn’t work for me
nice to see people caring about accessibility around here :heart:
Nope, that won’t work on it’s own
<https://api.HubSpot.com/cosindex/api/v1/connections/>{asset id}/parents?portalId={portalid}&hapikey={hapikey}
so with the Reports > Analytics > Prospects tool in HubSpot you can see via IP which companies are visiting your site (so cool btw)
is there anyway to use this in conjunction with the CMS? so for example you could have specific content on your homepage for traffic coming from a known company?
OK, I see its an actual API endpoint. i thought it’s a link to the documentation
thanks
Where is revision history in the new page editor?
Hover over Autosaved
smh
thanks
any time
No documentation.
but it works
